verses.kjv: Woe to the crown of pride, to the drunkards of Ephraim, whose glorious beauty is a fading flower, which are on the head of the fat valleys of them that are overcome with wine!
verses.web: Woe to the crown of pride of the drunkards of Ephraim, and to the fading flower of his glorious beauty, which is on the head of the fertile valley of those who are overcome with wine!
verses.ct: Disaster is coming for the proud crown of Ephraim's drunkards! Their stunning beauty is like a wilting flower, sitting atop a rich valley — and its people are staggering with wine!

verses.kjv: Behold, the Lord hath a mighty and strong one, which as a tempest of hail and a destroying storm, as a flood of mighty waters overflowing, shall cast down to the earth with the hand.
verses.web: Behold, the Lord has a mighty and strong one. Like a storm of hail, a destroying storm, and like a storm of mighty waters overflowing, he will cast them down to the earth with his hand.
verses.ct: Look — the Lord has someone powerful and mighty at his command. Like a hailstorm, like a devastating tornado, like a flood of raging water, he will hurl them to the ground with force.

verses.kjv: The crown of pride, the drunkards of Ephraim, shall be trodden under feet:
verses.web: The crown of pride of the drunkards of Ephraim will be trodden under foot.
verses.ct: That proud crown of Ephraim's drunkards will be trampled underfoot.

verses.kjv: And the glorious beauty, which is on the head of the fat valley, shall be a fading flower, and as the hasty fruit before the summer; which when he that looketh upon it seeth, while it is yet in his hand he eateth it up.
verses.web: The fading flower of his glorious beauty, which is on the head of the fertile valley, shall be like the first-ripe fig before the summer; which someone picks and eats as soon as he sees it.
verses.ct: Their stunning beauty, perched above that fertile valley, will wilt like a dying flower. It will be like an early fig that ripens before harvest — the moment someone spots it, they snatch it and swallow it whole.

verses.kjv: In that day shall the LORD of hosts be for a crown of glory, and for a diadem of beauty, unto the residue of his people,
verses.web: In that day, LORD of Armies will become a crown of glory and a diadem of beauty to the residue of his people,
verses.ct: On that day, the LORD of hosts will become a crown of glory and a beautiful diadem for the remnant of his people.

verses.kjv: And for a spirit of judgment to him that sitteth in judgment, and for strength to them that turn the battle to the gate.
verses.web: and a spirit of justice to him who sits in judgment, and strength to those who turn back the battle at the gate.
verses.ct: He will give a spirit of justice to those who sit as judges, and strength to those who drive the enemy back from the gates.

verses.kjv: But they also have erred through wine, and through strong drink are out of the way; the priest and the prophet have erred through strong drink, they are swallowed up of wine, they are out of the way through strong drink; they err in vision, they stumble in judgment.
verses.web: They also reel with wine, and stagger with strong drink. The priest and the prophet reel with strong drink. They are swallowed up by wine. They stagger with strong drink. They err in vision. They stumble in judgment.
verses.ct: But even these people stumble from wine and stagger from strong drink. Priests and prophets reel from alcohol — swallowed up by wine, thrown off course by strong drink. Their visions are blurred, and their judgments are confused.

verses.kjv: For all tables are full of vomit and filthiness, so that there is no place clean.
verses.web: For all tables are completely full of filthy vomit and filthiness.
verses.ct: Every table is covered with vomit and filth, with not a clean spot anywhere.

verses.kjv: Whom shall he teach knowledge? and whom shall he make to understand doctrine? them that are weaned from the milk, and drawn from the breasts.
verses.web: Whom will he teach knowledge? To whom will he explain the message? Those who are weaned from the milk, and drawn from the breasts?
verses.ct: They mock the prophet, saying, "Who does he think he's teaching? Who is he explaining his message to? Babies just weaned from their mother's milk?"

verses.kjv: For precept must be upon precept, precept upon precept; line upon line, line upon line; here a little, and there a little:
verses.web: For it is precept on precept, precept on precept; line on line, line on line; here a little, there a little.
verses.ct: "It's just rule after rule, rule after rule, line after line, line after line — a little here, a little there!"

verses.kjv: For with stammering lips and another tongue will he speak to this people.
verses.web: But he will speak to this nation with stammering lips and in another language,
verses.ct: Fine then — God will speak to this people through foreign lips and a strange language.

verses.kjv: To whom he said, This is the rest wherewith ye may cause the weary to rest; and this is the refreshing: yet they would not hear.
verses.web: to whom he said, “This is the resting place. Give rest to weary,” and “This is the refreshing;” yet they would not hear.
verses.ct: He had told them, "This is the place of rest — let the weary find rest here. This is where you'll find refreshment." But they refused to listen.

verses.kjv: But the word of the LORD was unto them precept upon precept, precept upon precept; line upon line, line upon line; here a little, and there a little; that they might go, and fall backward, and be broken, and snared, and taken.
verses.web: Therefore LORD’s word will be to them precept on precept, precept on precept; line on line, line on line; here a little, there a little; that they may go, fall backward, be broken, be snared, and be taken.
verses.ct: So the LORD's word to them will become rule after rule, rule after rule, line after line, line after line, a little here, a little there — until they stumble backward, get broken, get trapped, and get captured.

verses.kjv: Wherefore hear the word of the LORD, ye scornful men, that rule this people which is in Jerusalem.
verses.web: Therefore hear LORD’s word, you scoffers, that rule this people in Jerusalem:
verses.ct: So listen to the word of the LORD, you arrogant leaders who rule over this people in Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: Because ye have said, We have made a covenant with death, and with hell are we at agreement; when the overflowing scourge shall pass through, it shall not come unto us: for we have made lies our refuge, and under falsehood have we hid ourselves:
verses.web: “Because you have said, ‘We have made a covenant with death, and we are in agreement with Sheol. When the overflowing scourge passes through, it won’t come to us; for we have made lies our refuge, and we have hidden ourselves under falsehood.’ ”
verses.ct: You brag, "We've cut a deal with death itself, and we have an agreement with the grave. When the overwhelming disaster sweeps through, it won't touch us — because we've built our shelter out of lies and hidden behind deception."

verses.kjv: Therefore thus saith the Lord GOD, Behold, I lay in Zion for a foundation a stone, a tried stone, a precious corner stone, a sure foundation: he that believeth shall not make haste.
verses.web: Therefore the Lord LORD says, “Behold, I lay in Zion for a foundation a stone, a tried stone, a precious cornerstone of a sure foundation. He who believes shall not act hastily.
verses.ct: But this is what the Lord GOD says: "Look — I am placing a foundation stone in Zion, a tested stone, a precious cornerstone, a rock-solid foundation. Whoever believes in it will not panic."

verses.kjv: Judgment also will I lay to the line, and righteousness to the plummet: and the hail shall sweep away the refuge of lies, and the waters shall overflow the hiding place.
verses.web: I will make justice the measuring line, and righteousness the plumb line. The hail will sweep away the refuge of lies, and the waters will overflow the hiding place.
verses.ct: "I will make justice my measuring line and righteousness my plumb line. Hail will demolish your shelter of lies, and floodwaters will sweep away your hiding place."

verses.kjv: And your covenant with death shall be disannulled, and your agreement with hell shall not stand; when the overflowing scourge shall pass through, then ye shall be trodden down by it.
verses.web: Your covenant with death shall be annulled, and your agreement with Sheol shall not stand. When the overflowing scourge passes through, then you will be trampled down by it.
verses.ct: "Your deal with death will be canceled, and your agreement with the grave will collapse. When the overwhelming disaster sweeps through, you will be crushed beneath it."

verses.kjv: From the time that it goeth forth it shall take you: for morning by morning shall it pass over, by day and by night: and it shall be a vexation only to understand the report.
verses.web: As often as it passes through, it will seize you; for morning by morning it will pass through, by day and by night; and it will be nothing but terror to understand the message.”
verses.ct: "Every time it passes through, it will seize you — morning after morning, day and night. And when you finally understand this message, it will fill you with nothing but terror."

verses.kjv: For the bed is shorter than that a man can stretch himself on it: and the covering narrower than that he can wrap himself in it.
verses.web: For the bed is too short to stretch out on, and the blanket is too narrow to wrap oneself in.
verses.ct: The bed is too short to stretch out on, and the blanket is too narrow to wrap around yourself.

verses.kjv: For the LORD shall rise up as in mount Perazim, he shall be wroth as in the valley of Gibeon, that he may do his work, his strange work; and bring to pass his act, his strange act.
verses.web: For LORD will rise up as on Mount Perazim. He will be angry as in the valley of Gibeon; that he may do his work, his unusual work, and bring to pass his act, his extraordinary act.
verses.ct: The LORD will rise up as he did at Mount Perazim. He will rage as he did in the valley of Gibeon — to carry out his work, his unexpected work, and accomplish his task, his extraordinary task.

verses.kjv: Now therefore be ye not mockers, lest your bands be made strong: for I have heard from the Lord GOD of hosts a consumption, even determined upon the whole earth.
verses.web: Now therefore don’t be scoffers, lest your bonds be made strong; for I have heard a decree of destruction from the Lord, LORD of Armies, on the whole earth.
verses.ct: So stop your mocking now, or your chains will only get tighter. I have heard it straight from the Lord GOD of hosts — total destruction has been decreed against the whole earth.

verses.kjv: Give ye ear, and hear my voice; hearken, and hear my speech.
verses.web: Give ear, and hear my voice! Listen, and hear my speech!
verses.ct: Pay attention and listen to what I'm saying! Hear me out!

verses.kjv: Doth the plowman plow all day to sow? doth he open and break the clods of his ground?
verses.web: Does he who plows to sow plow continually? Does he keep turning the soil and breaking the clods?
verses.ct: Does a farmer plow his field forever? Does he keep breaking up the soil endlessly?

verses.kjv: When he hath made plain the face thereof, doth he not cast abroad the fitches, and scatter the cummin, and cast in the principal wheat and the appointed barley and the rie in their place?
verses.web: When he has leveled its surface, doesn’t he plant the dill, and scatter the cumin seed, and put in the wheat in rows, the barley in the appointed place, and the spelt in its place?
verses.ct: Once he's leveled the ground, doesn't he scatter dill and plant cumin? Doesn't he sow wheat in rows, barley in its proper section, and spelt along the edges?

verses.kjv: For his God doth instruct him to discretion, and doth teach him.
verses.web: For his God instructs him in right judgment and teaches him.
verses.ct: His God teaches him the right way to do it and shows him how.

verses.kjv: For the fitches are not threshed with a threshing instrument, neither is a cart wheel turned about upon the cummin; but the fitches are beaten out with a staff, and the cummin with a rod.
verses.web: For the dill are not threshed with a sharp instrument, neither is a cart wheel turned over the cumin; but the dill is beaten out with a stick, and the cumin with a rod.
verses.ct: You don't thresh dill with a heavy sledge or roll a cart wheel over cumin. Instead, dill is beaten out with a stick, and cumin with a rod.

verses.kjv: Bread corn is bruised; because he will not ever be threshing it, nor break it with the wheel of his cart, nor bruise it with his horsemen.
verses.web: Bread flour must be ground; so he will not always be threshing it. Although he drives the wheel of his threshing cart over it, his horses don’t grind it.
verses.ct: Grain for bread must be ground, but no farmer threshes it forever. He may drive his cart wheel over it, but he doesn't crush it to powder with his horses.

verses.kjv: This also cometh forth from the LORD of hosts, which is wonderful in counsel, and excellent in working.
verses.web: This also comes out from LORD of Armies, who is wonderful in counsel, and excellent in wisdom.
verses.ct: This wisdom also comes from the LORD of hosts, whose plans are wonderful and whose skill is beyond compare.
